resources.string: Small manual and infos about Inetify
Not all location providers are enabled, finding an accurate location might not be possible.
Could not get an accurate location.

Features 

Test Connectivity tests internet access. It does this by downloading the page title of an internet site and comparing it with an expected title. 
If enabled in the settings, Inetify runs this test automatically whenever your phone connects to a Wifi network and gives a notification depending on the result. 

Ignored Wifi Networks allows to exclude Wifi networks from the automatic internet connectivity test. Any Wifi network in the list will be ignored. 
To add a Wifi network to the list, click on Ignore Wifi Network while the phone is connected to that Wifi network. This can also be done from a notification. 
To remove a Wifi network from the list, click long on the item and choose Remove. 

Wifi Locations (experimental) allows to add the location of a Wifi network. When the phone is near enough one of the locations in the list, Wifi is automatically activated or a notification given, or both. When none of the locations are near, Wifi is deactivated, which can save battery. 
This feature is experimental: Depending on the accuracy of localization, it may be unreliable. 
To add a Wifi location to the list, click on Add Wifi Location while the phone is connected to that Wifi network. Inetify then finds the current location, shows it on a map and adds it to the list. When clicking on a Wifi location in the list, the location is shown on a map. 
To remove a Wifi location from the list or rename it, click long on the item and choose Remove or Rename, respectively. 
Please note, that the map data is downloaded from the internet, and can cause costs when using a mobile data connection. 

Settings 

Notifications Enabled Enables or disables notifications about internet access of a Wifi network. 

Only if not OK If set, a notification is given only if internet access is not available. 

Internet Site The internet site whose page title is compared with the expected title, to verify internet access. Default is www.google.com. 

Page Title The page title that the internet site is expected to have. Default is Google. 

Notifications Enabled Enables or disables notifications about near Wifi locations. 

Auto Wifi If set, Wifi is activated when the nearest Wifi location is near enough, and deactivated when no Wifi location is near enough. Wifi is not deactivated while it is connected to a Wifi network. 

Use GPS If set, GPS is used additionally to network based locations. GPS is very accurate, but it does not work indoors and uses considerably more battery than network based localization. 

Max. Distance Is the distance to the nearest Wifi location not longer than this setting, the notification is given and/or Wifi activated. Is the distance longer, Wifi is deactivated. 
With a short max. distance, the risk that a Wifi location is not recognized because of inaccurate localization is higher. GPS increases accuracy, but it works reliably only outdoors. 

Check Interval The time between location checks. When using GPS, longer intervals decrease battery usage. 

Notification Tone The tone that is used for notifications. 

Notification Light If set, the LED flashes on notifications. 

Please send feedback to: 
gmdode@gmail.com 

Project and source code: 
http://code.google.com/p/inetify 

Inetify ist licensed under the Apache License 2.0. 

Thank you for installing Inetify! 

Acknowledgements 

To load and parse the internet site and get the page title from it, Inetify uses jsoup: 
http://jsoup.org 

The Inetify icons were composed of two icons from Oxygen Icons: 
http://www.oxygen-icons.org
Notification only if internet connectivity is not OK
All or a part of the page title that the internet site is expected to have
Higher accuracy, works only outdoors, higher energy consumption
